# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function that should accomplish what you're asking for:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = []
    current_block = IOBuffer()

    in_code_block = false

    for line in eachline(md)
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            in_code_block = true
            continue
        end

        if startswith(line, "```") && in_code_block
            in_code_block = false
            push!(code_blocks, String(take!(current_block)))
            current_block = IOBuffer()
            continue
        end

        if in_code_block
            write(current_block, line)
        end
    end

    # catch any remaining code block
    if !eof(current_block)
        push!(code_blocks, String(take!(current_block)))
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```

This function works by iterating over each line in the markdown document and checking if it is the beginning or end of a code block. If it is the beginning of a code block, it sets the `in_code_block` flag to `true` and continues to the next line. If it is the end of a code block, it writes the contents of the `current_block` buffer to an array of code blocks and resets the buffer. If it is in a code block, it writes the line to the `current_block` buffer. Finally, after the loop has finished, it checks if there is any remaining code in the `current_block` buffer and writes it to the array if necessary.

The function then joins all the code blocks in the array with a newline and returns the result.
